definition: to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: This special point of breakthrough is the naissance of human beings.
sentences.chinese: 这个特殊的突破点就是人类的诞生。

sentences.english: The key point to elucidate nonconventional phenomenon is the normal-breaking thinking.
sentences.chinese: 对偶然现象的非逻辑思维是自然认知的突破点。

sentences.english: It's a breakthrough point of reformation for deepening our basic education that founding a feature school.
sentences.chinese: 创建特色学校是深化我国基础教育改革的一个突破点。

definition: short stave of the barrel (which allows the contents to escape)/(fig.) shortcoming/weak point
a way out (lit. and fig.)/opportunity for advancement/a way forward/outlet (for one's products)
hard lump in the abdomen (in Chinese medicine)/crux of an issue/main point in an argument/sticking point/deadlock in negotiations
